results.title: Potash deficiency Hamilton district
results.brief_description: No sound. Long-duration shots of clovers, fields and farmers walking through fields. Ends with footage of a manually-operated farming device that either plants seeds or removes plants.

results.title: Potash deficiency
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Tony Doogood
results.brief_description: Potash deficiency occurs in older pastures ad sandy areas in Victoria. The rate of depletion is shown by the fact that 2 and a half tons of hay remove 1 cwt. of potash from the soil. The symptoms of this deficiency in pastures; how to apply potassium fertilizers; pasture management to prevent deficiency; the economics of costs and returns from the use of potassium fertilizers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Tony Doogood

results.title: Pot purri
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Colin Low, Vic Jobin, Jeffrey Hale, Derek Lamb, Kaj Pindal, Grant Munro, Cameron Guers and Rhoda Leyer
results.brief_description: A selection of publicity clips mounted together in one film to show techniques of NFB animators. As in ‘Hors d’oeuvre’, these films were produced originally for Government Agencies, to carry a message to the public about fire, water, traffic safety and mailing early for Christmas. Punctuated with adroit sound effects, each clip drives home its message humorously and succinctly.

results.title: Pot planet

A look at the microcosmic Pot Planet, its ecosystem and its energy sources. Uses a mix of computer animation and live-action.

results.title: Pot luck
results.creator_credit: Pilgrim Films, Betti Wood and Ossie Emery
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Fisherman’s World”.
An unplanned fishing trip, looking for likely fishing spots and taking pot luck. Fish caught include flathead, small baitfish and jewfish.

results.title: Pot-Bouille = House of Lovers
results.creator_credit: Robert Hakim, Raymond Hakim and Julien Duvivier
results.brief_description:
Penniless Octave Mouret arrives in Paris at the turn of the Century to take up a job as assistant in a draper shop run by Madame Hedouin. She takes a fancy to him, as do two girls in the house where he lodges. In this adaptation of Zola’s novel Duvivier is less interested in Octave than in the life of the building, a real melting pot of the vices of the 19th century Paris bourgeoisie.

Credits: Producers, Robert and Raymond Hakim ; director, Julien Duvivier ; writers, Henri Jeanson, Leo Joannon, Julien Duvivier ; photography, Michel Kelber ; music, Jean Wiener ; art direction, Leon Barsacq.
Cast: Gerard Philippe, Danielle Darrieux, Dany Carrel, Anouk Aimee, Jacques Rispal, Jane Marken, Olivier Hussenot.

results.title: Pot
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
Desmond Wilcox introduces and acts as interviewer/chairman with an audience of schoolboys, parents, doctors, & man from the council for civil Liberties, other scientists, a policeman, released pot smokers & others, to discuss the pros & cons of legalising cannabis in the U.K.

results.title: Posture and locomotion
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Arnold Gesell
results.brief_description: Follows child development from helpless immaturity to controlled locomotion. First the infant only kicks and wriggles, then gradually he learns to control position and posture by pivoting, creeping, standing, cruising, walking and running. A consecutive biographic series depicting thirteen different age levels enables a detailed study of comparatively rapid progress.
results.description: Follows child development from helpless immaturity to controlled locomotion. First the infant only kicks and wriggles, then gradually he learns to control position and posture by pivoting, creeping, standing, cruising, walking and running. A consecutive biographic series depicting thirteen different age levels enables a detailed study of comparatively rapid progress.

results.title: Posture and exercise
results.brief_description: This film explains muscle action, and the physiology of exercise. Concepts presented include the relation of the nervous system to the skeletal muscles, motor units of work, development of endurance, muscle tonus in relation to posture, and peripheral circulation as it is related to physical efficiency.

results.title: Postnatal care
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Education for Childbirth”.
Shows the mother in her hospital room, doing exercises, caring for her baby, nursing etc. It discusses the father’s relation to the new situation and portrays some of the joy to be found in the new family constellation. Diagrams show how the mother’s body returns to normal.
